definitions.example: I was so sleepy that I hardly took in any of the lecture.

definitions.definition: To allow a person or an animal to live in one's home.
To receive (goods) into one's home for the purpose of processing for a fee.
definitions.example: In hard times, some women would take in washing and others dressmaking repairs.

definitions.definition: To shorten (a garment) or make it smaller.
definitions.example: Try taking the skirt in a little around the waist.

definitions.definition: To tighten (a belaying rope). (Also take up.)
To subscribe to home delivery of.
